thread.title: Fire in Withington, Manchester sees four children rushed to hospital | Metro News
thread.title_full: Fire in Withington, Manchester sees four children rushed to hospital | Metro News

author: Richard Hartley-Parkinson For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Fire in Withington, Manchester sees four children rushed to hospital | Metro News

organizations.name: greater manchester fire and rescue service

text:
Richard Hartley-Parkinson for Metro.co.uk Friday 10 Feb 2017 8:41 am Back of the house on Parsonage Road in Withington that was the scene of a serious fire this morning pic.twitter.com/jyM5N0h1cv 
— Michelle Adamson (@michellea951) February 10, 2017 
Three girls, a boy and a man have all been taken to hospital after a fire at a house. 
Firefighters were called to the blaze in Withington, Manchester, at about 2.20am on Friday. 
A spokesman for Greater Manchester Fire and Rescue Service said one man and four children, aged between 10 and 17, were taken to hospital. 
Four fire engines were called to the scene in Parsonage Road, along with police and ambulances. 
The cause of the blaze is due to be investigated jointly with Greater Manchester Police. Serious fire this morning at house on corner of Parsonage Rd and St Chads Rd in Withington. 5 people taken to hospital. pic.twitter.com/sM9dARY4za 
— Michelle Adamson (@michellea951) February 10, 2017 Parsonage Road, Manchester,where the fire broke out 
A Greater Manchester Police spokesman said the three girls and a boy were being treated in hospital for their injuries. 
The man who was also taken to hospital was said to be in a serious condition. 
GMP Superintendent Mark Kenny said: ‘This is a tragic incident and we are working closely with GMFRS to establish exactly how this fire started. 
‘We want to speak to anyone who may have witnessed the fire, or were in the area in the hours before the fire.’ 
Anyone with information should contact police on 101 quoting incident number 140 10/02/17 or the independent charity Crimestoppers, anonymously, on 0800 555 111. More
